Issues.Title: The Inspector hangs when the user creates a circular dependency for the ListViewGroup and ListViewItem
Issues.Body:
.NET Core Version:
.NET SDK 5.0.100-rc.1.20420.14

Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?:
No

**Minimal repro:**
1. Create application with list view.
2. Create ListViewGroup
3. Create ListViewItem linked to ListViewGroup
4. Add ListViewItem to ListViewGroup
5. Add ListViewGroup to ListView
6. Add ListViewItem to ListView
7. Run application.
8. Run Inspector.
9. Try to get data about ListViewItem in Inspector.
10. Or just user attached [WindowsFormsApp3.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5310765/WindowsFormsApp3.zip)


**Expected behavior:**
Data about selected ListViewItem should be displayed.

**Actual behavior:**
Inspector hangs or return that the ListViewGroup contains a huge number of ListViewItems
![ListViewAndInspector](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/94789698-edf76000-03dd-11eb-9c85-348bad3717f3.jpg)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The Inspector hangs when the user creates a circular dependency for the ListViewGroup and ListViewItem" (#4045)

Issues.Title: ListView in virtual mode doesn't throw exception when user tries to add ListViewGroup
Issues.Body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
ListView in virtual mode does not support ListViewGroup. If user tries to add ListViewGroup then he will see an exception. But if handle for ListView is not created then user has ability to add group to ListView. As result user has workaround for adding of group ListView in virtual mode, although ListViewGroups  are not supported by ListView

**Describe the solution you'd like and alternatives you've considered**
I suggest to throw exception regardless of whether the ListView has handle or not. Thus, the user will not be able to add a ListViewGroup to ListView in virtual mode

**Will this feature affect UI controls?**
It impacts on adding of ListViewGroups to ListView. But the current behavior of the ListView seems to be incorrect
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ListView in virtual mode doesn't throw exception when user tries to add ListViewGroup" (#4044)

Issues.Title: ListView is in virtual mode throws IOE when user disables checkboxes
Issues.Body:
- .NET Core Version:
.NET SDK 5.0.100-rc.1.20420.14

- Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?:
Yes

**Minimal repro:**

1. Create application with ListView in virtual mode
2. Enable checkboxes
3. Disable checkboxes
4. Or use attached [WindowsFormsApp3.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5310459/WindowsFormsApp3.zip)

![ListView - checkboxes](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/94779836-360f8600-03d0-11eb-87d7-654cf082fd46.gif)
**StackTrace:**
```
   at System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.get_Count()
   at System.Windows.Forms.ListView.set_CheckBoxes(Boolean value)
   at WindowsFormsApp3.Form1.Button1_Click(Object sender, EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnClick(EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Button.OnClick(EventArgs e)
```

**Expected behavior:**
Checkboxes should be disabled without exceptions

**Actual behavior:**
'Cannot access the checked items collection when the ListView is in virtual mode.' exception is displayed
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ListView is in virtual mode throws IOE when user disables checkboxes" (#4042)

Issues.Title: Fixing issue that Narrator cannot focus on ListView second time
Issues.Body:
Fixes #4030


## Proposed changes

- added calling of "RaiseAutomationEvent" method to "OnGotFocus" method for ListViewItem that had focus. This call returns the Narrator focus (blue rectangle) back to the element;
- added unit tests

## Customer Impact
Narrator focus doesn't switches between ListView when user presses Tab button:
![4030-broken](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/94689418-84247b00-0337-11eb-9744-c4583f9a2264.gif)
After fixing, Narrator focus works correctly:
![4030-fixed](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/94689509-a0281c80-0337-11eb-95aa-6ab9685ca603.gif)


## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Minimal

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manually
-  Unit tests

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->
- Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.19041.388]
- .NET Core 5.0.100-rc.1.20420.14

Issues.Title: Accessibility] Narrator cannot focus on a ListView for the second time(1 listView on form) or the second listView control( 2 listViews on form)
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
.Net SDK 5.0.100-rc.2.20477.2

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

* More info
This is a regression issue, cannot repro in .Net Core 3.1

**Minimal repro:**
1.	Open the attached WinFormsApp9.zip application in VS, which contains 2 ListViews on form, then build and run it.
[WinFormsApp9.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5302869/WinFormsApp9.zip)

2.	Launch Narrator to focus on ListViews controls

**Actual behavior:**
Narrator cannot focus on the second ListView control by pressing Tab keyboard, the blue rectangle still focus on the first listView control
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/94637692-cdaaa100-030a-11eb-9f99-941cee6dccf5.png)

**Expected behavior:**
Narrator cannot focus on every ListView control by pressing Tab keyboard
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Accessibility] Narrator cannot focus on a ListView for the second time(1 listView on form) or the second listView control( 2 listViews on form)" (#4030)

Issues.Title: Unable to identify scroll bar "Page down" or other internal scroll bar object using UIAutomation
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/docs/issue-guide.md -->

* .NET Core Version: 3.0.1.302
<!-- e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info` -->

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No
<!-- Yes / No -->

**Problem description:**
 scroll bar page down, page up buttons are unidentifiable using .netcore3.1. The same was working with net472.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36397242/94436977-c5dbe700-01ba-11eb-8655-d66adbba995f.png)




**Expected behavior:**
It should identify the objects with .net core also.



**Minimal repro:**
PFA the sample projects
[WindowsFormsApp1.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5292473/WindowsFormsApp1.zip)
[NetCoreSample.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5292475/NetCoreSample.zip)
[netframeworkCode.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5292476/netframeworkCode.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unable to identify scroll bar "Page down" or other internal scroll bar object using UIAutomation" (#4020)

Issues.Title: Adding Toggle pattern support for ListView items
Issues.Body:
- Fixes #4029
- Relates to PR #3963 and PR #3224

## Proposed changes

- Implement Toggle pattern for ListViewItemAccessibleObject if CheckBoxes is true
- Add on/off Narrator announcement for ListView items if CheckBoxes is true

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- Now a user can hear if a ListView item is checked(on) or unchecked(off) using Narrator

## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49272759/94745939-62051a00-0384-11eb-82fc-bb6ef46701df.png)


### After
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49272759/94745982-777a4400-0384-11eb-8568-87a6359565a6.png)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49272759/94746355-33d40a00-0385-11eb-90a6-03d5aea2f2db.png)




## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Unit tests
- Manual testing

## Accessibility testing  <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->
- using Inspect and Narrator
<!--
     Microsoft prioritizes making our products accessible. 
     WinForms has a key role in allowing developers to create accessible apps. 
     
     When submitting a change which impacts UI in any way, including adding new UI or
     modifying existing controls the developer needs to run the Accessibility Insights
     tool (https://accessibilityinsights.io/) and verify that there are no changes or
     regressions. 
     
     The developer should run the Fast Pass over the impacted control(s) and provide
     a snapshot of the passing results along with before/after snapshots of the UI.
     More info: (https://accessibilityinsights.io/docs/en/web/getstarted/fastpass)
  -->


 

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- .Net Version: 5.0.0-rc.2.20472.5
- Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.19041.508]

<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] Keyboard cannot check/uncheck listView items when enabling listView checkBox property in Virtual Mode
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
.Net SDK 5.0.100-rc.2.20477.2

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
Yes

**Minimal repro:**
1. Open the attached ListViewInVirtualMode.zip application in VS, then build and run it.
[ListViewInVirtualMode.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5303187/ListViewInVirtualMode.zip)
2. Focus on ListView item, press Space to check/uncheck it in its checkBox

**Actual behavior:**
Keyboard cannot check/uncheck listView items' checkBox by pressing "Space" in ListView virtual mode, and for mouse, need double-click to check/uncheck, not single-click.
![ListViewVirtualModeIssue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/94645595-cf7e5f80-031e-11eb-8a94-eed6ba558aae.gif)

**Expected behavior:**
Keyboard can check/uncheck listView items' checkBox by pressing "Space" in ListView virtual mode, like the result in default mode
![ListViewDefaultMode](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/94645601-d2795000-031e-11eb-8679-ac2f9316cd4d.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] Keyboard cannot check/uncheck listView items when enabling listView checkBox property in Virtual Mode" (#4033)

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] In Inspect, the listView items text’s ControlType, LocalizedControlType, LegacyIAccessible.Role properties are not correct when listView LabelEdit is true
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
.Net SDK 5.0.100-rc.2.20477.2

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

* More Info
This is a regression issue, cannot repro in .Net Core 3.1

**Minimal repro:**
1. Open the attached WinFormsApp9.zip application in VS, then build and run it.
[WinFormsApp9.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5302987/WinFormsApp9.zip)
2. Launch Inspect to focus on ListView item text in edit state

**Actual behavior:**
In Inspect, the listView items text’s ControlType, LocalizedControlType, LegacyIAccessible.Role properties are not correct when listView LabelEdit is true
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/94639828-af936f80-030f-11eb-8b1c-2e9095b119fc.png)

**Expected behavior:**
In Inspect, the listView items text’s ControlType, LocalizedControlType, LegacyIAccessible.Role properties are correct when listView LabelEdit is true
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/94639852-c20da900-030f-11eb-805c-56024a8d72a1.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] In Inspect, the listView items text’s ControlType, LocalizedControlType, LegacyIAccessible.Role properties are not correct when listView LabelEdit is true" (#4032)

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] An element of the given ControlType must support the Text pattern when the DataGridViewTextBoxCell is not in the editing state
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: .Net SDK 6.0.100-alpha.1.20479.7

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
Yes

**Minimal repro:**

1. Open the attached [DataGridViewTextBoxCell.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5302789/DataGridViewTextBoxCell.zip) application in VS, then build and run it.
2. Open Accessibility Insights and test the Column1 in Form.

**Expected behavior:**
An element of the given ControlType support the Text pattern. The behavior should be like following screenshot from the DataGridViewTextBoxCell is in the editing state.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864649/94635258-d4361a00-0304-11eb-9286-dfb871d7584d.png)

**Actual behavior:**
There is an error message: An element of the given ControlType must support the Text pattern. Following screenshot from the DataGridViewTextBoxCell is not in the editing state
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864649/94635271-dac49180-0304-11eb-8824-dc9cceb993d2.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] An element of the given ControlType must support the Text pattern when the DataGridViewTextBoxCell is not in the editing state" (#4031)

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] Narrator cannot announce the check/uncheck state of ListView item when enabling listView checkBox property
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
.Net SDK 5.0.100-rc.2.20477.2
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No
* More info
This is a regression issue, cannot repro in .Net Core 3.1

**Minimal repro:**
1.	Open the attached WinFormsApp9.zip application in VS, then build and run it.
[WinFormsApp9.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5302826/WinFormsApp9.zip)
2.	Launch Narrator to focus on each ListView items

**Actual behavior:**
**Narrator**: it cannot announce the check/uncheck state of ListView item when enabling listView checkBox property
**Inspect:** Missing Toggle.ToggleState property, and IsTogglePattermAvailable property is false
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/94636634-1d3b9d80-0308-11eb-89a6-86b8f2840ff7.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/94636645-23317e80-0308-11eb-83a1-3a0281b3817e.png)
**Expected behavior:**
Narrator: it announce the check/uncheck state of ListView item as on/off when enabling listView checkBox property
Inspect: it has Toggle.ToggleState property and supports IsTogglePattermAvailable property
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/94636865-c5516680-0308-11eb-83ca-4017cd793594.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/94636896-d4381900-0308-11eb-9600-07b4ba3bba1b.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] Narrator cannot announce the check/uncheck state of ListView item when enabling listView checkBox property" (#4029)

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] AccessibilityInsight for ListView: An element of the given ControlType must not support the Table pattern
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
.Net SDK 5.0.100-rc.2.20477.2

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
Yes

**Minimal repro:**
1. Open the attached WinFormsApp9.zip application in VS, then build and run it.
[WinFormsApp9.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5302743/WinFormsApp9.zip)
2. Open AccessibilityInsight tool to focus on ListView control to get result

**Actual behavior:**
An error about "An element of the given ControlType must not support the Table pattern" for ListView control
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/94634630-19f1e300-0303-11eb-9090-abf38f269bed.png)

**Expected behavior:**
No error is detected by AccessiblityInsight
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] AccessibilityInsight for ListView: An element of the given ControlType must not support the Table pattern" (#4028)

Issues.Title: Designer doesn't work for 32-bit projects
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.1, 5.0 RC1

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**Problem description:**

The new WinForms designer seems to always run as 64-bit process. This causes an issue when the application that is being developed is targeted to use 32-bit runtime (eg. `<RuntimeIdentifier>win-x86</RuntimeIdentifier>` specified in .csproj file). The designer process then tries to load the project assembly and fails:
```
[01:20:10.4528879] [DesignerInheritenceBug]: fail: WinFormsSurface.Services.TypeResolutionService[0]
[01:20:10.4528879] [DesignerInheritenceBug]:       Failed to load assembly: C:\Users\Filip Navara\AppData\Local\Temp\WinFormsCache\vhfep02y.e1h\DesignToolsServer\UserAppData\DesignerInheritenceBug.dll
[01:20:10.4528879] [DesignerInheritenceBug]:       System.IO.FileLoadException: Could not load file or assembly 'DesignerInheritenceBug, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null'.
[01:20:10.4528879] [DesignerInheritenceBug]:          at System.Runtime.Loader.AssemblyLoadContext.LoadFromPath(IntPtr ptrNativeAssemblyLoadContext, String ilPath, String niPath, ObjectHandleOnStack retAssembly)
[01:20:10.4528879] [DesignerInheritenceBug]:          at System.Runtime.Loader.AssemblyLoadContext.LoadFromAssemblyPath(String assemblyPath)
[01:20:10.4528879] [DesignerInheritenceBug]:          at WinFormsSurface.Services.TypeResolutionService.LoadFromAssemblyPath(String filePath)
[01:20:10.4538890] [DesignerInheritenceBug]: fail: WinFormsSurface.Services.TypeResolutionService[0]
[01:20:10.4538890] [DesignerInheritenceBug]:       Failed to load assembly: DesignerInheritenceBug, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null
[01:20:10.4538890] [DesignerInheritenceBug]:       System.IO.FileLoadException: Could not load file or assembly 'DesignerInheritenceBug, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null'. Could not find or load a specific file. (0x80131621)
[01:20:10.4538890] [DesignerInheritenceBug]:       File name: 'DesignerInheritenceBug, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null'
[01:20:10.4538890] [DesignerInheritenceBug]:        ---> System.IO.FileLoadException: Could not load file or assembly 'DesignerInheritenceBug, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null'.
[01:20:10.4538890] [DesignerInheritenceBug]:          at System.Runtime.Loader.AssemblyLoadContext.LoadFromPath(IntPtr ptrNativeAssemblyLoadContext, String ilPath, String niPath, ObjectHandleOnStack retAssembly)
[01:20:10.4538890] [DesignerInheritenceBug]:          at System.Runtime.Loader.AssemblyLoadContext.LoadFromAssemblyPath(String assemblyPath)
[01:20:10.4538890] [DesignerInheritenceBug]:          at System.Runtime.Loader.AssemblyLoadContext.ResolveUsingLoad(AssemblyName assemblyName)
[01:20:10.4538890] [DesignerInheritenceBug]:          at System.Runtime.Loader.AssemblyLoadContext.Resolve(IntPtr gchManagedAssemblyLoadContext, AssemblyName assemblyName)
[01:20:10.4538890] [DesignerInheritenceBug]:          at System.Reflection.RuntimeAssembly.nLoad(AssemblyName fileName, String codeBase, RuntimeAssembly assemblyContext, StackCrawlMark& stackMark, Boolean throwOnFileNotFound, AssemblyLoadContext assemblyLoadContext)
[01:20:10.4538890] [DesignerInheritenceBug]:          at System.Reflection.RuntimeAssembly.InternalLoadAssemblyName(AssemblyName assemblyRef, StackCrawlMark& stackMark, AssemblyLoadContext assemblyLoadContext)
[01:20:10.4538890] [DesignerInheritenceBug]:          at System.Reflection.Assembly.Load(AssemblyName assemblyRef, StackCrawlMark& stackMark, AssemblyLoadContext assemblyLoadContext)
[01:20:10.4538890] [DesignerInheritenceBug]:          at System.Runtime.Loader.AssemblyLoadContext.LoadFromAssemblyName(AssemblyName assemblyName)
[01:20:10.4538890] [DesignerInheritenceBug]:          at WinFormsSurface.Services.TypeResolutionService.LoadAssembly(AssemblyName assemblyName)
```

The .dll compiled with these options has the following headers:
```
File Header:
  Machine:                       0x014C (Intel x86)
  Number of Sections:            3
  Time Date Stamp:               0xCD7DCE1C (4/1/2079 1:27:24 PM)
  Pointer to Symbol Table:       0x00000000
  Number of Symbols:             0
  Size of Optional Header:       0x00E0 (224)
  Characteristics:               0x0102
    File is executable
    32 bit word machine

CLR Header:
  .NET 2.0+ Assembly
  Flags:                         0x00000003
    IL only
    32 bit required
```

**Expected behavior:**

The designer should work.

Ideally it should run as 32-bit process since that would allow loading 32-bit native libraries that may be required by the project. If that is not possible for some reason than it should be properly documented and report a more reasonable error to the user than "base type XY could not be loaded".

**Minimal repro:**

[DesignerInheritenceBug.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5302373/DesignerInheritenceBug.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Designer doesn't work for 32-bit projects" (#4026)

Issues.Title: Winforms .Designer file corrupted when it contains User Control
Issues.Body:
**Visual Studio Version**:
Version 16.8.0 Preview 3.1
**Summary**:
If you open a Form with a reference to a  UserControl in Design view, make no changes and close the Designer. all the UserControl properties that are set in Designer are deleted (everything except the first and last line below)
The first and last line are changed to add the Namespace from the project file which caused the fill namespace to be DefaultNameSpace.DefaultNameSpace
```VB
    Me.LineNumbersForConversionInput = New DefaultNameSpace.LineNumbersForRichTextBox()
        '
        'LineNumbersForConversionInput
        '
        Me.LineNumbersForConversionInput.BackgroundGradientAlphaColor = System.Drawing.Color.FromArgb(CType(CType(0, Byte), Integer), CType(CType(0, Byte), Integer), CType(CType(0, Byte), Integer), CType(CType(0, Byte), Integer))
        Me.LineNumbersForConversionInput.BorderLinesThickness = 1.0!
        Me.LineNumbersForConversionInput.Dock = System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle.Left
        Me.LineNumbersForConversionInput.GridLinesThickness = 1.0!
        Me.LineNumbersForConversionInput.LineNrsOffset = New System.Drawing.Size(0, 0)
        Me.LineNumbersForConversionInput.Location = New System.Drawing.Point(0, 0)
        Me.LineNumbersForConversionInput.Margin = New System.Windows.Forms.Padding(0)
        Me.LineNumbersForConversionInput.MarginLinesThickness = 1.0!
        Me.LineNumbersForConversionInput.Name = "LineNumbersForConversionInput"
        Me.LineNumbersForConversionInput.Padding = New System.Windows.Forms.Padding(0, 0, 2, 0)
        Me.LineNumbersForConversionInput.ParentRichTextBox = Me.ConversionInput
        Me.LineNumbersForConversionInput.Size = New System.Drawing.Size(23, 491)
        Me.LineNumbersForConversionInput.TabIndex = 23
        Me.LineNumbersForConversionInput.Visible = False
    Friend WithEvents LineNumbersForConversionInput As DefaultNameSpace.LineNumbersForRichTextBox
```

**Steps to Reproduce**:

1. Add a UserControl to a Form in Framework
2. Open in Core 3.1 or 5.0 RC
A sample is here
https://github.com/paul1956/CSharpToVB/blob/master/CSharpToVB/Forms/Form1.Designer.vb

**Expected Behavior**:
The designer file should not change or the file should not open in designer YET.
**Actual Behavior**:
File is corrupted
**User Impact**:
Accidently opening a Form with UserControls corrupts the document, this is a silent change which makes it very bad.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Winforms .Designer file corrupted when it contains User Control" (#4023)

Issues.Title: The "ListView" property is not set for a ListViewGroup when a ListViewItem with this ListViewGroup is added to the ListView
Issues.Body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
If user creates ListViewGroup, creates ListViewItem that linked to this ListViewGroup and adds ListViewItem to ListView then ListViewGroup does not appear in ListView. As a result ListView has ListViewItem linked with a ListViewGroup that is not associated with ListView. After execution of following code:
```
var listViewGroup = new ListViewGroup("Test group");
var listViewItem = new ListViewItem("Test item", listViewGroup);
listView.Items.Add(listViewItem);
```
ListViewGroup will not be displayed in ListView. Property "ListView" also will be empty for ListViewGroup.

**Describe the solution you'd like and alternatives you've considered**
I suggest to add ListViewGroup to ListView when user adds ListViewItem that associated with ListViewGroup.
As a result if user executes code above then:

- ListViewGroup should be added to ListView and should be displayed in ListView.Groups collection
- ListView property of ListViewGroup should have ListView to which the ListViewItem was added
- If ListViewGroup already has another ListView then we should throw IOE.

Also it will avoid the case where the user has ListViewItems that linked to a ListViewGroup but forgot to add the ListViewGroup to the ListView

**Will this feature affect UI controls?**
This issue is specific for ListView. Also it will help to avoid problem with ListViewGroupAccessibleObject, because we can not get AccessibleObject for ListViewGroup when it has not ListView.
